verses.verse: (Instructions concerning Prayer) First of all, then, I urge that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made for everyone,
(Ezra 6.10; Rom 13.1) for kings and all who are in high positions, so that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and dignity.
(Rom 12.2; 1 Tim 4.10) This is right and acceptable before God our Savior,
(Jn 3.16; 2 Tim 2.25) who desires everyone to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
(Gal 3.20; Heb 9.15) For there is one God; there is also one mediator between God and humankind, Christ Jesus, himself human,
(Mk 10.45; 1 Cor 1.6; Gal 4.4) who gave himself a ransom for all â€”this was attested at the right time.

(Gal 1.16; Eph 3.7, 8) For this I was appointed a herald and an apostle (I am telling the truth; (Other ancient authorities add in Christ) I am not lying), a teacher of the gentiles in faith and truth.
I desire, then, that in every place the men should pray, lifting up holy hands without anger or argument,
also that the women should dress themselves in moderate clothing with reverence and self-control, not with their hair braided or with gold, pearls, or expensive clothes,
but with good works, as is proper for women who profess reverence for God.
Let a woman (Or wife) learn in silence with full submission.
I do not permit a woman (Or wife) to teach or to have authority over a man; (Or her husband) she is to keep silent.
(Gen 1.27; 1 Cor 11.8) For Adam was formed first, then Eve,
(Gen 3.6; 2 Cor 11.3) and Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived and became a transgressor.
Yet she will be saved through childbearing, provided they continue in faith and love and holiness, with self-control.
